title: 820-2915 No Power
message:
Hi all,

I have a nightmare board - quite literally was destroyed by another company.

History is liquid damage and some poor rework.

Current symptoms: Green light and draws 0.26 amps (CPU/GPU are warm)

I have replaced the SMC twice now as I thought the above was caused by that and most of the 3.42v net as it was all missing. Q7030 was also shorted and now replaced.

PPBUS_G3H = 12.59v
PP3V42 = Present along with SMC_BCACOK

Can anyone think of a possible cause for 0.26amps --> i'm starting to think the CPU/GPU has a short :-(

Any ideas welcome before I say goodbye to this board?

title: 820-2915 No Power
message:
Maybe some magician can completely solve an issue looking at the ampers only..
You've wasted time changing SMC in base of an assumption, without basics measurements.

First step, BEFORE powering a MLB, check resistance to grouind on all (big) coils.
A short, or low value on any, will show you where to continue; no need to power board to eliminate short/low value on power rails.
Maybe is not your case now (to have short), I just wrote it as general rule.

To get more than 25-30mA, the board should exit from S5 state.
Check 3V3_SUS, 5V_SUS, 3V3_S5.
To get warm, CPU/GPU need some S0 voltages.
If not present, then some leakage on their power supplies maybe...

Check PM_RSMRST_L and PCH's RTC signals.
See if PM_PWRBTN_L and PM_SLP_Sx_L signals react when simulate pressing power button (R5015/16).

Then come abck with more information...
